Key Match Events: Steph Curry came up with four immediate assists, solidifying the Warriors' offense.
Curry then added five more points, making a couple of free throws and knocking down a buzzer-beating three-point shot to end the first half.
Come the third quarter, Steph Curry popped off for 15 points to start the second half.
He finished with 24 points, six assists, and three rebounds, matched with 46.7% shooting from the field.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors were on a three-game winning streak despite not having Curry in their lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: It wasn't his best shooting performance, but it was efficient enough to lead the Warriors to victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Golden State Warriors notched their fourth consecutive victory and second straight on the road after beating the Washington Wizards on Monday.
Buddy Hield once again proved why he's the second option for Golden State as he came up with an all-around performance adding 20 points, five rebounds, two steals, and one block.
Four other Warriors players were in double-scoring figures.
Others: Warriors coach Steve Kerr didn't want to overwork his ankle and sat him down for the majority of the first quarter.
